context: Jesus speaks of forgiveness beyond what anyone had ever considered before: seventy times seven! Many commentaries understand this to mean that Jesus was telling Peter that he should forgive his brother a limitless number of times.
To err is human, to forgive, divine. We are commanded to forgive 'seventy times seven', but that applies when remorse or repentance is offered.

If there is an unforgivable sin it is surely to maintain that someone is beyond forgiveness. And doing so with an air of self-righteousness. How many times must I forgive? Seven times? No, seventy times seven times. We all fail.

The New English Translation (NET) is one of the few that gets the literal reference Jesus made of forgiveness with "seventy times seven" right. It is not 70 x 7 = 490. The expression is forgive 70 times, then add another 7 to it, which is more like 77. But the meaning remains.
Jesus answered: I do not tell you up to seven, but even up to seventy times seven. I woke up feeling so hurt.. How does one honestly really forgive and forget?

Some say that means that we have to forgive 77 times and others say that's 490 times: seventy times seven. So, imagine if God actually kept score of our forgiveness of each other, the same way that we keep score of how others have wronged us.

Jesus said to him, I do not say to you, up to seven times, but up to seventy times seven. That's actually 490, not 77. However Jesus' point wasn't the actual number, but that we not count the times we should forgive one another.
Seventy Times Seven (2017) -- A man's wife is murdered and he has to choose between revenge and forgiveness. (Watching on Tubi)

Some trivia for your #ComeFollowMe discussions: the number of times Jesus says we should forgive in Matt 18:22 is likely seventy-seven, not "seventy times seven" as the KJV puts it. Of course, if we're overly concerned about particular numbers here, we're missing Jesus's point!

Some people believe that being able to forgive seventy times seven and to love with an unwavering love is a weak and docile act. Such people don't know anything and speak of ignorance. They do not know true unbreakable inner strength.

I'm the Bible when it says God forgives Seventy times seven (which is 490), is he being literal, and he only forgives that many times? Or is he being metaphorical, and he forgives more than that?

Christ referred to this 490 year probationary period when Peter asked Him if he should forgive his brother "seven times." Yet, #Christ said "seventy times seven" [490]. For Christ, as one with His Father, gave His brethren, the Jews, a 490 year window of forgiveness to repent.

Remember the one that told us to forgive seventy times seven will also do this for you. He'll forgive you and love you so much you'll be able to stand on your own two feet. Have faith my fellow Christians in the Lord, or just a babe in Christ!

Instead, Jesus told him, "No, not seven times . . . but seventy times seven!" (verse 22 NLT). In other words Jesus was saying, "You should forgive endlessly. There should be no limits to your forgiveness."
Did you know? In Matthew 18:22 when Jesus tells us to forgive seventy times seven, the number 77 indicates infinity. In other words, Jesus is telling us to forgive an infinite number of times.
